page.title: 15Mixed farming in Elton
page.content: On our farm (67% arable,23% grazing) the main crops are wheat,oilseed rape and barley.The main animals are sheep (1000 ewes) and cattle (280 calves for fattening each year).We have to make silage in the summer as stock for the cattle to eat in winter.Silage is made by putting hay into plastic bags and leaving it for a while.Then it turns into green hay which is known as silage.In the lambing time when the sheep have lambs someone has to go out in the night to see if any lambs have been born.If we did not a lamb might die because the afterbirth might cover the lamb's face which would stop it breathing.Shearing takes place in summer,when the sheep's wool is taken off because it is too hot.The woollen fleeces are taken away to be sold.
